description.narrative: An additional 500,000 people in 5 most deprived regions live in Open Defecation Free (ODF) communities and use improved latrines, which contributes to Sanitation. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 009 : 54% of population have sustainable and equitable access to and use of basic sanitation services underpinned by improved hygiene practices and sustainable water services by 2016.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: An additional 500,000 people in 5 most deprived regions live in Open Defecation Free (ODF) communities and use improved latrines

description.narrative: Government was supported to improve national behaviour change programmes, and to develop the building blocks of sanitation supply, demonstrated by communities self-financing construction of toilets for over 130,000 people. Social-protection financing models were demonstrated and the National Sanitation Campaign launched by the President with an open defecation free Ghana agenda. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:21/12/2017

title.narrative: Number of communities certified free of open defecation in the reporting year only as a result of UNICEF direct support

actual.value: 2017:Sector Review has commenced by urban sanitation strategy development team
